rules: Rule1: If artwork2 meets the security condition, then the exhibition is ready.
Rule2: Artwork2 is damaged or, assuming it is insured, it can be exhibited.
Rule3: Whenever sculpture1 meets the transport condition, it is packaged.
Rule4: If sculpture1 is packaged, then artwork2 is not damaged.
Rule5: If painting1 meets the framing condition, then the exhibition is ready.
Rule6: Provided that painting1 is displayed, it meets the framing condition.
Rule7: If photograph1 is displayed, then painting1 is displayed.
Rule8: Provided that the committee has funding for the exhibition, it has a venue.
Rule9: Installation1 has insurance or, if it is displayed, then photograph1 is displayed.
Rule10: If event1 is scheduled, then it is cancelled.
Rule11: Event1 is scheduled or, if lacking the committee having a venue implies it has approval, then the committee does not have an alternative venue.
Rule12: Artist1 has confirmed attendance at event1 or, if event1 is rescheduled, then it is not cancelled.
Rule13: Under the condition that collector1 approves the loan of painting1, if the committee has funding, then it has approval.
Rule14: Either collector1 approves the loan of painting1 or collector2 does.
Rule15: If painting1 has transport, then, assuming the committee has funding, it has approval.
Rule16: Whenever the gallery authorizes an extension of the loan period, if not having collector2 approve the loan implies painting1 has transport, then painting1 has a local substitute.
Rule17: Either the gallery authorizes an extension of the loan period or the museum does.
Rule18: If the curator meets the deadline for the catalog, then the loan period has not violated contract.
Rule19: If artwork3 meets the conservation condition, then the exhibition does not have a budget cut.
Rule20: If artwork3 is restored, then it is cleaned.
Rule21: Provided that the committee has permission for the exhibition, it has approval.
Rule22: Assuming critic1 has confirmed attendance at the opening, if the committee has resolved the legal issue, then the exhibition does not have a legal issue.
Rule23: The opening has media coverage or, if critic1 has not confirmed attendance, then critic2 has.
Rule24: Provided that painting1 has the spotlight, it is properly lit.
Rule25: Either painting1 has the spotlight or photograph1 does.
Rule26: If photograph1 has the spotlight, then painting1 is displayed.
Rule27: Under the condition that technician1 has verified the lighting for painting1, if it is properly lit, then it is displayed.
Rule28: Provided that technician2 has verified the lighting for painting1, if it is properly lit, then it is displayed.
Rule29: If artwork4 meets the temperature condition, then painting1 does not have a lighting issue.
Rule30: Artwork4 meets the temperature condition or it meets the humidity condition.
Rule31: Under the condition that artwork4 meets the humidity condition, painting1 does not have a lighting issue.
Rule32: If not having collector2 approve the loan implies painting1 has transport, then painting1 does not have a local substitute.
Rule33: If not having the committee have a venue implies it has approval, then the committee has an alternative venue.

Rule34: If not having the museum authorize an extension implies that not having collector2 approve the loan implies painting1 has transport, then it has a local substitute, then the loan period has violated contract.
Rule35: If it is not the case that the exhibition has sponsorship or, if the exhibition is not ready, then the committee has approval, then the exhibition has a budget cut.
Rule36: Provided that it is not the case that technician1 has verified the lighting for painting1 or technician2 has, then painting1 has a lighting issue.
Rule37: If it is not the case that artwork1 meeting the lighting condition implies the exhibition is ready, then artwork1 needs restoration.
Rule38: Under the condition that it is not the case that artwork1 needing restoration implies it has completed restoration, then artwork1 has failed restoration.
Rule39: If it is not the case that not having the committee have a venue implies it has approval, then the committee does not have an alternative venue, then the committee has a backup plan.

Rule40: Whenever it is not the case that not not having the committee have a venue implies it has approval, then the committee does not have an alternative venue, then the committee does not have a backup plan, then the committee has a contingency.

Rule41: If it is not the case that not not having the committee have a venue implies it has approval, then the committee does not have an alternative venue, then the committee does not have a backup plan, then the committee does not have a contingency.
Rule42: Under the condition that it is not the case that the exhibition not being ready implies the committee has permission, then the exhibition has a legal issue.
Rule43: Provided that it is not the case that the exhibition not being ready implies the committee has permission, then the committee has resolved the legal issue.
Rule44: Assuming artwork2 does not meet the security condition, it is insured.
Rule45: Provided that artwork2 does not meet the security condition, it cannot be exhibited.
Rule46: Whenever artwork3 does not meet the conservation condition, it is restored.
Rule47: Under the condition that artwork3 does not meet the conservation condition, it is not cleaned.
Rule48: Provided that critic1 has not confirmed attendance at the opening, then critic2 has not.
Rule49: Assuming the exhibition is not ready, the committee has funding.
Rule50: Provided that the exhibition is not ready, the committee does not have approval.
facts: Fact1: Sculpture1 meets the transport condition.
Fact4: The curator meets the deadline for the catalog.
Fact5: Artwork1 meets the lighting condition.
Fact6: Artwork1 has not failed restoration.
Fact7: Installation1 does not have insurance.
Fact8: Artist1 has not confirmed attendance at event1.
Fact9: The exhibition does not have sponsorship.
Fact10: The opening does not have media coverage.
Fact11: Artwork1 has not completed restoration.
